author: 0x1984
content: Guys what is the main roadblock to have a few seconds block time, 30-60% less than current current block time? safety margin or hardware/network concern?

author: sky.cactus
content: Coordination time, which is a combination of network speed and processing time.

author: _shemnon
content: There's also the sheer size of the network.  With 20-40 validators 3-6 seconds is reasonable.  With over 5k network nodes and 500K validators it becomes unrealistic.  No other PoS network has the volume of nodes and validators Eth does at the moment.

author: 0x1984
content: I feels that making ETH viable for real life transactions like buying a coffee, the transaction has to be done in a few seconds. With the natural performance upgrade of minimum hardware specs + QUIC p2p(http3), this is doable. Maybe preliminary consensus can be achieved in a few seconds with a selected subset validators, but finality can still wait much longer. dApps can choose how many blocks they want to wait to approve tx based on tx amount or other criteria
